intro: Xyris araracuarae, commonly known as the Araracuara goldeneye, is a rare species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest in Brazil. It belongs to the Xyridaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, grass-like foliage and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded understory environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Xyris araracuarae is considered a vulnerable species.
